ch4.tcp
Class TCPSender

java.lang.Object
  ch4.tcp.TCPSender
Direct Known Subclasses:
TCPSenderTahoe
public abstract class TCPSender
extends java.lang.Object

The base class for TCP senders.

Note: If you are in doubt or some of this code is conflicting your textbook, please check the ultimate sources: RFC 2581 and RFC 2001.
Do not rely on any textbooks for precise details!
Read the textbook(s) for high-level understanding of the material; read the RFCs for precise details.

Author:
Ivan Marsic

Field Detail

CONG_AVOID

protected static final int CONG_AVOID
Type of sending mode: Congestion avoidance, i.e., additive increase.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

congWindow

protected int congWindow
Current congestion window size, in bytes.

dupACKsGlobal

protected int dupACKsGlobal
Counter of duplicate acknowledgements over multiple subsequent RTT periods. Dup-acks must be counted over subsequent RTT periods (iterations), not only in a single RTT cycle because they still carry the same meaning.

lastByteAcked

protected int lastByteAcked
Pointer to the last byte ACKed so far. Recall that the bytes are numbered from zero, so the sequence number of the first byte is zero, etc.

lastByteSent

protected int lastByteSent
Pointer to the last byte sent so far. Recall that the bytes are numbered from zero, so the sequence number of the first byte is zero, etc.

sendMode

protected int sendMode
Current sending mode; default value is SLOW_START.

SLOW_START

protected static final int SLOW_START
Type of sending mode: Slow start.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

SSThresh

protected int SSThresh
The threshold value at which the slow start sending mode should kick in.

timer

protected int timer
Retransmission timer, in RTT/iteration units. The timer is activated at the begining of a transmission cycle. When all outstanding segments are acknowledged, the timer is deactivated. When a regular acknowledgement is received and there are still outstanding, non-acknowledged segments, the timer should be re-started.

TIMER_DEFAULT

protected static final int TIMER_DEFAULT
Default value of the timer, in our case equals to 3 × RTT.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

TCPSender

public TCPSender()
Method Detail

getTotalBytesTransmitted

public int getTotalBytesTransmitted()
Accessor for retrieving the statistics of the total number of bytes successfully transmitted so far during this simulation. This value is used for statistics gathering and reporting purposes.

Returns:
Returns the cumulative number of bytes successfully transmitted thus far.

processAcks

public abstract int processAcks(TCPSegment[] acks_)
Processes ACKs received from the receiver. Checks for duplicate ACKs. May detect timeout timer expiration. Informs about the transmission outcome, as one of the options: TCPSimulator#SUCCESS, TCPSimulator#DUP_ACKx3, or TCPSimulator#TIMEOUT.

Parameters:
acks_ - The acknowledgements array, as received from the receiver.
Returns:
Returns a summary about the outcome of the previous transmission.

send

public abstract void send(TCPSegment[] segments_,
                          int rcvWindow_,
                          boolean lostPacket_)
"Sends" segments by indicating in the array what segments should be sent in this iteration. After this method, the array segments_ will contain the segments to be sent. The sender sends only two type of segments: full MSS segments and 1-byte segments; the receiver must be able to distinguish between these.

Parameters:
segments_ - The array of segments, to be filled in this method.
rcvWindow_ - The size of the currently available space in the receiver's buffer.
lostPacket_ - Informs whether or not a packet loss was detected for the previous transmission.
